item.title: Responsible Statistic Education and Common Misinterpretations
item.description: An understanding of statistics is necessary to be able to correctly interpret the data we see and understand itâ€™s validity. However, there are many common misunderstandings surrounding statistics and probability. Without an understanding of the validity of findings, people, even those who have been taught introductory statistics, can be led to false conclusions with real world consequences. Responsible Statistic Education and Common Misinterpretations Statistics used to be a small area of study, reserved for researchers to analyze their results.
